verses.kjv: And the children of Israel did evil again in the sight of the LORD; and the LORD delivered them into the hand of the Philistines forty years.
verses.web: The children of Israel again did that which was evil in LORD’s sight; and LORD delivered them into the hand of the Philistines forty years.
verses.ct: Once again, the LORD saw that the people of Israel were evil. So he handed them over to the Philistines, who dominated them for 40 years.

verses.kjv: And there was a certain man of Zorah, of the family of the Danites, whose name was Manoah; and his wife was barren, and bare not.
verses.web: There was a certain man of Zorah, of the family of the Danites, whose name was Manoah; and his wife was barren, and childless.
verses.ct: There was a man named Manoah from the town of Zorah, from the tribe of Dan. His wife had never been able to have children.

verses.kjv: And the angel of the LORD appeared unto the woman, and said unto her, Behold now, thou art barren, and bearest not: but thou shalt conceive, and bear a son.
verses.web: LORD’s angel appeared to the woman, and said to her, “See now, you are barren and childless; but you shall conceive and bear a son.
verses.ct: The angel of the LORD appeared to the woman and said, "I know you've been unable to have children, but you're going to become pregnant and give birth to a son.

verses.kjv: Now therefore beware, I pray thee, and drink not wine nor strong drink, and eat not any unclean thing:
verses.web: Now therefore please beware and drink no wine nor strong drink, and don’t eat any unclean thing;
verses.ct: So be very careful — don't drink any wine or other alcohol, and don't eat anything that is unclean.

verses.kjv: For, lo, thou shalt conceive, and bear a son; and no razor shall come on his head: for the child shall be a Nazarite unto God from the womb: and he shall begin to deliver Israel out of the hand of the Philistines.
verses.web: for, behold, you shall conceive and give birth to a son. No razor shall come on his head, for the child shall be a Nazirite to God from the womb. He shall begin to save Israel out of the hand of the Philistines.”
verses.ct: You will become pregnant and have a son. No razor must ever touch his head, because from the moment he's born, the child will be set apart as a Nazirite to God. He will be the one who begins to rescue Israel from the Philistines."

verses.kjv: Then the woman came and told her husband, saying, A man of God came unto me, and his countenance was like the countenance of an angel of God, very terrible: but I asked him not whence he was, neither told he me his name:
verses.web: Then the woman came and told her husband, saying, “A man of God came to me, and his face was like the face of the angel of God, very awesome. I didn’t ask him where he was from, neither did he tell me his name;
verses.ct: The woman went and told her husband, "A man of God came to me. His face was like the face of an angel of God — absolutely terrifying. I didn't ask where he came from, and he didn't tell me his name.

verses.kjv: But he said unto me, Behold, thou shalt conceive, and bear a son; and now drink no wine nor strong drink, neither eat any unclean thing: for the child shall be a Nazarite to God from the womb to the day of his death.
verses.web: but he said to me, ‘Behold, you shall conceive and bear a son; and now drink no wine nor strong drink. Don’t eat any unclean thing, for the child shall be a Nazirite to God from the womb to the day of his death.’ ”
verses.ct: But he told me, 'You're going to become pregnant and have a son. Don't drink any wine or alcohol, and don't eat anything unclean, because the child will be a Nazirite to God from the day he's born until the day he dies.'"

verses.kjv: Then Manoah intreated the LORD, and said, O my Lord, let the man of God which thou didst send come again unto us, and teach us what we shall do unto the child that shall be born.
verses.web: Then Manoah entreated LORD, and said, “Oh, Lord, please let the man of God whom you sent come again to us, and teach us what we should do to the child who shall be born.”
verses.ct: Manoah prayed to the LORD and said, "Please, Lord, let the man of God you sent come back to us again and teach us how to raise the child who is going to be born."

verses.kjv: And God hearkened to the voice of Manoah; and the angel of God came again unto the woman as she sat in the field: but Manoah her husband was not with her.
verses.web: God listened to the voice of Manoah, and the angel of God came again to the woman as she sat in the field; but Manoah, her husband, wasn’t with her.
verses.ct: God listened to Manoah's prayer. The angel of God appeared to the woman again while she was sitting in the field, but her husband Manoah wasn't with her.

verses.kjv: And the woman made haste, and ran, and shewed her husband, and said unto him, Behold, the man hath appeared unto me, that came unto me the other day.
verses.web: The woman hurried and ran, and told her husband, saying to him, “Behold, the man who came to me that day has appeared to me,”
verses.ct: She quickly ran to her husband and told him, "The man who came to me the other day — he's appeared to me again!"

verses.kjv: And Manoah arose, and went after his wife, and came to the man, and said unto him, Art thou the man that spakest unto the woman? And he said, I am.
verses.web: Manoah arose and followed his wife, and came to the man, and said to him, “Are you the man who spoke to my wife?” He said, “I am.”
verses.ct: Manoah got up and followed his wife back to the man. "Are you the one who spoke to my wife?" he asked. The man replied, "I am."

verses.kjv: And Manoah said, Now let thy words come to pass. How shall we order the child, and how shall we do unto him?
verses.web: Manoah said, “Now let your words happen. What shall the child’s way of life and mission be?”
verses.ct: Manoah said, "When your words come true, how should we raise the boy? What should we do with him?"

verses.kjv: And the angel of the LORD said unto Manoah, Of all that I said unto the woman let her beware.
verses.web: LORD’s angel said to Manoah, “Of all that I said to the woman let her beware.
verses.ct: The angel of the LORD answered Manoah, "Your wife must carefully follow everything I told her.

verses.kjv: She may not eat of any thing that cometh of the vine, neither let her drink wine or strong drink, nor eat any unclean thing: all that I commanded her let her observe.
verses.web: She may not eat of anything that comes of the vine, neither let her drink wine or strong drink, nor eat any unclean thing. Let her observe all that I commanded her.”
verses.ct: She must not eat anything that comes from the grapevine, and she must not drink wine or any other alcohol, or eat anything unclean. She must do everything I commanded her."

verses.kjv: And Manoah said unto the angel of the LORD, I pray thee, let us detain thee, until we shall have made ready a kid for thee.
verses.web: Manoah said to LORD’s angel, “Please stay with us, that we may make a young goat ready for you.”
verses.ct: Manoah said to the angel of the LORD, "Please stay a while — let us prepare a young goat for you to eat."

verses.kjv: And the angel of the LORD said unto Manoah, Though thou detain me, I will not eat of thy bread: and if thou wilt offer a burnt offering, thou must offer it unto the LORD. For Manoah knew not that he was an angel of the LORD.
verses.web: LORD’s angel said to Manoah, “Though you detain me, I won’t eat your bread. If you will prepare a burnt offering, you must offer it to LORD.” For Manoah didn’t know that he was LORD’s angel.
verses.ct: The angel of the LORD replied, "Even if you keep me here, I won't eat your food. But if you want to prepare a burnt offering, offer it to the LORD." Manoah said this because he still didn't realize he was speaking to the angel of the LORD.

verses.kjv: And Manoah said unto the angel of the LORD, What is thy name, that when thy sayings come to pass we may do thee honour?
verses.web: Manoah said to LORD’s angel, “What is your name, that when your words happen, we may honor you?”
verses.ct: Then Manoah asked the angel of the LORD, "What is your name? When everything you've said comes true, we'd like to honor you."

verses.kjv: And the angel of the LORD said unto him, Why askest thou thus after my name, seeing it is secret?
verses.web: LORD’s angel said to him, “Why do you ask about my name, since it is incomprehensible?”
verses.ct: The angel of the LORD replied, "Why do you ask my name? It is beyond understanding."

verses.kjv: So Manoah took a kid with a meat offering, and offered it upon a rock unto the LORD: and the angel did wonderously; and Manoah and his wife looked on.
verses.web: So Manoah took the young goat with the meal offering, and offered it on the rock to LORD. Then the angel did an amazing thing as Manoah and his wife watched.
verses.ct: So Manoah took a young goat and a grain offering and sacrificed them on a rock to the LORD. Then, as Manoah and his wife watched, the angel did something miraculous.

verses.kjv: For it came to pass, when the flame went up toward heaven from off the altar, that the angel of the LORD ascended in the flame of the altar. And Manoah and his wife looked on it, and fell on their faces to the ground.
verses.web: For when the flame went up toward the sky from off the altar, LORD’s angel ascended in the flame of the altar. Manoah and his wife watched; and they fell on their faces to the ground.
verses.ct: As the flame rose from the altar toward heaven, the angel of the LORD ascended right up into the flame. When Manoah and his wife saw this, they fell facedown on the ground.

verses.kjv: But the angel of the LORD did no more appear to Manoah and to his wife. Then Manoah knew that he was an angel of the LORD.
verses.web: But LORD’s angel didn’t appear to Manoah or to his wife any more. Then Manoah knew that he was LORD’s angel.
verses.ct: The angel of the LORD never appeared to Manoah or his wife again. That was when Manoah finally realized the visitor had been the angel of the LORD.

verses.kjv: And Manoah said unto his wife, We shall surely die, because we have seen God.
verses.web: Manoah said to his wife, “We shall surely die, because we have seen God.”
verses.ct: Manoah said to his wife, "We're going to die! We've seen God!"

verses.kjv: But his wife said unto him, If the LORD were pleased to kill us, he would not have received a burnt offering and a meat offering at our hands, neither would he have shewed us all these things, nor would as at this time have told us such things as these.
verses.web: But his wife said to him, “If LORD were pleased to kill us, he wouldn’t have received a burnt offering and a meal offering at our hand, and he wouldn’t have shown us all these things, nor would he have told us such things as these at this time.”
verses.ct: But his wife said to him, "If the LORD wanted to kill us, he wouldn't have accepted our burnt offering and grain offering. He wouldn't have shown us all these things or told us what he did just now."

verses.kjv: And the woman bare a son, and called his name Samson: and the child grew, and the LORD blessed him.
verses.web: The woman bore a son and named him Samson. The child grew, and LORD blessed him.
verses.ct: The woman gave birth to a son and named him Samson. The boy grew up, and the LORD blessed him.

verses.kjv: And the Spirit of the LORD began to move him at times in the camp of Dan between Zorah and Eshtaol.
verses.web: LORD’s Spirit began to move him in Mahaneh Dan, between Zorah and Eshtaol.
verses.ct: The spirit of the LORD began to stir him while he was at the camp of Dan, in the area between Zorah and Eshtaol.
